titleStmt.title: Francis E. Skidmore to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6065

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bedford Trimble co
Kentucky Jany 23- 1865,
To His Excellency Thos E, Bramlett Governor of Kentuy

your Petitioner would respectfully represent that he was fined in three sCases at the October term of the circuit court for Trimble county 1863, fifty Dollars each for Selling liquor to Minors, your Excellency saw proper in great clemency to respite Said fines twelve months from that time.

He now humbly asks your Excellency in consequence of his not being aware that he was doing wrong thinking the said minors were of proper age, and further being a poor man, with a family to support and having had to feed a great many Soldiers & their Horses without any compensation. prays your Excellency to remit Said fine & in duty bound will ever pray &C &C

We the undersigned petitioners citizens of Trimble county would respectfully represent that the above
petitions Statements are true and Join him in his prayre &C &C

Silas Gatewood
William Drake
J, B. Mount
James Stanley
Wm O Stanly
J H McCarty
J. Y. Newkirk
Levi M Perkinson
L, G, Peck
W. P. Maddox
A. J. Harmon.
A. J. Wright
Ja. B. Cook
John W. Stewart
R T Hall
R. Bell
J. P. Strother
E M Garriott

Trimble Cir Ct
vs
F. E. Skidmore
3 judgts
$50, each
